title: Understand the Concept
text: To find out the temperature where liquid water and gaseous water are at equilibrium under a pressure of $$1$$ atm, consider the laws of thermodynamics.

title: Identify the Formula
text: Use the Gibbs Free Energy change formula in a thermodynamic process: $$ΔG=ΔH-TΔS$$. At equilibrium, $$ΔG=0$$.

title: Set Up the Equation
text: At equilibrium, set up the equation $$ΔH-TΔS=0$$. Rearrange to solve for temperature T.

title: Unit Conversion
text: Make sure all units are consistent when calculating T. Convert ΔS from J K⁻¹ mol⁻¹ to kJ K⁻¹ mol⁻¹ by dividing by $$1000$$.

title: Perform the Calculation
text:
Now calculate T using the values:
$$ΔH=40.67$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$
$$ΔS=109.3$$ $$ rac{J}{mol·K}$$ $$=$$ $$0.1093$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol·K}$$
